post: The Declaration of Independence is more than just a document, it's an "expression of the American mind" according to Thomas Jefferson. Rooted in John Locke's philosophy itt asserted that legitimate government stems from the consent of the governed. Learn more about how and why we celebrate this uniquely American holiday through our "Why Do we Celebrate the Fourth of July?" podcast  https://bit.ly/3TpJquC  #fourthofjuly  #AmericanHistory  #BRI

Recently, some inspiring high school students from Queens, NY, came together to celebrate civic engagement, creativity, and community service at the New York City MyImpact Challenge Fair, which was hosted by students for students. Based on the Bill of Rights Institutes national MyImpact Challenge, this event gave young changemakers the chance to showcase their incredible service projects, compete for monetary prizes, and inspire their peers to become leaders in their community. Watch the video today and look out for the announcement of the National Contest winner on July 7th!  https://bit.ly/3I2AE3o

Led by seasoned litigator Keith Altman, K Altman Law focuses on Student Defense, Special Education Law, Title IX, and Civil Rights litigation. We are grateful for their support of Civics for Everyone. Learn more about the initiative and how you can support the Institute!  https://bit.ly/4jBYuQp

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Bella Fajardo! Bella is a high school junior at a vocational academy for law and justice. She aspires to be an attorney and loves to read and write. She is a Girl Scout and is a part of the Teen Leadership Advisory Board for Girl Scouts Heart of New Jersey. She is also a part of Relay for Life, Speech and Debate, National Honor Society, and Spanish Honor Society. She is a poetry editor for Candlelit Chronicles, a literary magazine creating opportunities for emerging writers. Learn more about BRI's Student Fellowship!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h

Congratulations to Isra Khan, the 2024-25 grand prize winner of our Think the Vote contest! This Illinois student serves as a member of the Barrington High debate team, editor of the school literary magazine, and volunteers at local senior homes. She appreciates the opportunity Think the Vote provides to help students like her learn more about current events issues. Learn more about Isra and Think the Vote!  https://bit.ly/3TOEgZ9

As we anticipate celebrating the 249th anniversary of the Declaration of Independence this Friday, Frederick Douglass' critique of the injustice of slavery while affirming the promise of American ideals rings out. Explore how Douglass evolved from sharing his personal experiences to becoming one of the most powerful intellectual forces of the abolitionist movement in our latest Primary Source Essential on his speech What to the Slave is the Fourth of July?  Watch today!  https://bit.ly/3GfrL5W
